XA242.name: Introduction to Experience Architecture
XA242.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
XA242.description: Basic principles of user-centered design as applied to user experience. Usability, information architecture, interaction design, and service design practices, tools, conventions, and professional community.
XA242.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

XA310.name: Computational Thinking for the Humanities
XA310.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
XA310.description: Develop critical and ethical engagement with computational thinking. Uses problem-solving processes including pattern recognition, data representation, and algorithms. Explore relationships between computation and user experience, rhetoric, and design.
XA310.prerequisite: (XA 242 and WRA 210) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
XA310.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students. Approval of college.

XA333.name: Researching Experience Architecture (W)
XA333.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
XA333.description: Researching for product, services, and processes as applied to user experience. Contextual inquiry, field studies, card sorting, participatory design, interviewing, focus groups, and usability testing. Field trip required.
XA333.prerequisite: (XA 242) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

XA366.name: Managing Experience Architecture Projects
XA366.description: Managing user experience projects. Project management, staffing projects, scheduling projects, managing process, writing specifications, sales, budgeting.
XA366.prerequisite: (XA 242) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

XA375.name: Information Architecture
XA375.description: Theory and practice for architecting information, including understanding and developing taxonomies, folkonomies, site structures, tagging systems, and guided navigation for user experience.
XA375.prerequisite: (XA 242) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
XA375.restrictions: Open to undergraduate students in the Experience Architecture Major or approval of college.

XA444.name: Prototyping Experience Architecture
XA444.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
XA444.description: Process models used in the planning and designing of interactive experiences. Organization of information, user interactions, visual design attributes, prototyping methods, and interface design.
XA444.prerequisite: (XA 242) and completion of Tier I writing requirement

XA466.name: Experience Architecture Capstone
XA466.description: Integrate knowledge and skills acquired from previous courses. Conceptualization, planning, implementation, and assessment of a project, service, system or an idea in a collaborative setting.
XA466.prerequisite: (XA 242) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
XA466.restrictions: Open to juniors or seniors or approval of college.

XA482.name: Experience Architecture Internship
XA482.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
XA482.description: Field experience in a professional environment that supports, user experience, interaction design, design research, usability, information architecture, project management, interface development, and/or web development. Work under the supervision of a professional.
XA482.prerequisite: (XA 242) and completion of Tier I writing requirement
XA482.restrictions: Open to sophomores or juniors or seniors or approval of college.
